page.title: 03Traffic
page.content: The days when the area traded via the river have passed,few trains stop, but the A48 trunk road gives quick access to both England and Wales.Ten miles away and visible throughout the area lies the mighty Severn Bridge and M4.From there it is easy to quickly reach London,the South West or South Wales.Travelling North via Gloucester we connect easily with the M5/M6. Before the Severn Bridge much of the traffic to and from Wales trundled through Lydney.People wonder what effect a bridge closure would have in today's traffic.A traffic survey we carried out in May showed an average load of 330 vehicles per hour.What might it be without the bridge? The local council have long been pressing for a by-pass but no starting date has yet been announced or a definite route agreed.
